title: US confirms China has had a spy base in Cuba since at least 2019
description: China has been operating a spy base in Cuba since at least 2019, as part of a global effort by Beijing to upgrade its intelligence capabilities

title: Federal regulators promise safety review at all the major freight railroads
description: Officials say they plan to conduct safety investigations of all the major freight railroads over the next year

title: WATCH:  Child's tantrum gets nearly two and a half million views on TikTok
description: In Case You Missed It: A little girl just trying to express herself, but three-year-old Bridget only knows kind words to express her frustration and displeasure.

title: WATCH:  Swarm of bees contained after buzzing around New York City block
description: New York City was buzzing as a swarm of bees flew around a Manhattan block, but the NYPD and beekeepers arrived and were able to contain them.

title: Brittney Griner, Mercury teammates confronted at airport by 'provocateur,' WNBA says
description: The WNBA says Brittney Griner and her Phoenix Mercury teammates were confronted by a “provocateur” at a Dallas airport on Saturday

title: North Dakota tribe buys idle oil pipeline
description: A Native American tribe in North Dakota bought an idle pipeline from the energy company Enbridge to help deliver oil from wells on its reservation to the broader market

title: Israelis march against government's contentious plan to overhaul judiciary
description: Israelis are protesting for the 23rd week against plans by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s far-right government to overhaul the judiciary system

title: Heavy rains in northwest Pakistan leave 20 dead, 80 injured
description: Authorities say heavy rains swept through Pakistan’s northwest, causing several houses to collapse and leaving at least 25 people dead and 145 injured

title: Unabomber Ted Kaczynski found dead in prison cell
description: Ted Kaczynski, known as the Unabomber, was found dead in his prison cell Saturday morning, according to a Federal Bureau of Prisons spokesperson. He was 81.

title: What happens next in the Trump federal indictment?
description: Former President Trump's federal criminal trial concerning government documents could be speedy one.

title: Pope Francis takes doctors' advice to skip Sunday public blessing as he recovers from major surgery
description: Pope Francis' surgeon says the pontiff is following doctors' advice and he will skip Sunday's customary public blessing to allow him to better heal after abdominal surgery

title: Children who were stabbed in France no longer in life-threatening condition as suspect is charged
description: French judges have handed preliminary charges of attempted murder to a man suspected of stabbing four young children and two adults in a French Alps park

title: 2 dead, 1 injured, in shooting involving Kansas City police officer: Authorities
description: Two people are dead and a third person is injured after a shooting involving a Kansas City police officer Friday night, but few details were immediately available

title: Troops feel the heat, and several faint, as Prince William reviews military parade
description: Several soldiers have been overcome by the heat as they turned out in woolen tunics and bearskin hats to salute Prince William

title: 5 killed in explosion at rocket and explosives factory in Turkey
description: An official says an explosion at a rocket and explosives plant in Turkey caused a building to collapse, killing all five workers inside

title: San Francisco police: 9 victims hit but no deaths in Mission District mass shooting
description: "All are expected to survive their injuries,” police said.

title: New voting districts could change again in some states before the 2024 elections
description: More changes could be coming to voting districts in some states

title: Runway closed at Tokyo's Haneda airport after 2 jets accidentally contact each other
description: Two passenger planes have accidentally touched each other on a runway at a major Tokyo airport

title: Nicaragua confiscates properties of 222 opposition exiles
description: The government of Nicaragua has announced the confiscation of properties belonging to 222 opposition figures who were forced into exile in February after being imprisoned by the regime of President Daniel Ortega

title: Colorado man pleads guilty in Vermont murder for hire conspiracy
description: The Colorado man who prosecutors say abducted and killed a Vermont man as part of a murder for hire conspiracy has pleaded guilty to charges that could land him in prison for life

title: WATCH:  Cincinnati zoo welcomes first baby sloth
description: Zookeepers at the Cincinnati Zoo were thrilled to welcome their first baby sloth earlier this week. Both the mother and baby are “doing well and bonding behind the scenes,” the zoo says.

title: 4 children lost in the jungle for 40 days after a plane crash are found alive in Colombia
description: The children were alone and are now receiving medical attention.

title: American Airlines, JetBlue seek to keep some ties despite losing antitrust case
description: American Airlines and JetBlue are trying to salvage parts of their partnership in the Northeast, even after a federal judge ruled they must break up the deal
